data.title: R.I.P. Lisa Spoonauer ("Clerks")
data.meta_description:
She was 44.

Devastated to report that #LisaSpoonauer, who played Caitlin in #clerks, has passed away. In 1992, I went looking for Lisa without knowing...
data.text:
She was 44.

Kevin Smith

Lisa Ann Spoonauer's Obituary on Asbury Park Press

Lisa Ann Spoonauer

AGE: 44 â€¢ Jackson Twp

LISA ANN SPOONAUER, age 44, of Jackson Twp., NJ, passed away on Saturday, May 21, 2017, at home. She was born in Rahway, NJ, and raised in Freehold, NJ, settling in Jackson Twp. 6 years ago.

Lisa was predeceased by her Father, John Spoonauer. She is survived by her Husband, Tom Caron; her Daughter, Mia Spoonauer; her Stepson, Tyler Caron; her Mother, Dolores Spoonauer; her twin Brothers, Michael and Mark Spoonauer and their Families; and her Grandfather, Frank Figurelli. She is also survived by her Aunt, Laure Piatti and Family; her Uncle, Tom Donnelly and Family; and her Cousins, Heather Smith and Jaclyn Nielsen and their Families.

Lisa was a devoted mother and loving wife, and she was known for her strength, selflessness and faith. Early on, Lisa worked as an actress, and she went on to become a restaurant manager and event planner.

Lisa loved spending time with family and friends, helping anyone she could and laughing as much as she made other people laugh.

Relatives and friends are respectfully invited to attend Lisa's visitation on Friday, May 26, 2017, from 4-8 PM at the GEORGE S. HASSLER FUNERAL HOME, 980 Bennetts Mills Rd, Jackson Twp., NJ 08527. Her Funeral Liturgy will be offered on Saturday, May 27, 2017, at 9:30 AM at St. Aloysius Roman Catholic Church, 935 Bennetts Mills Rd, Jackson Twp., NJ. Please gather at the church at 9:15 AM. Entombment will follow in Maplewood Cemetery and Mausoleum, Route 537, Freehold Twp., NJ. If you wish to send flowers, please do so to the Hassler Funeral Home. The family also encourages donations to the Patient Advocate Foundation through Read Mike's story . For directions, further information or to send condolence messages to the family, please visit www.hasslerfuneralhome.com.

Published in Asbury Park Press on May 24, 2017
